body: And all at once it is the meadow I walked in at ten,Like some poor wounded wretchlong left for deadXI. Franklin's Last VoyageEnd of the comedy.Silent patch of ultimate paint. You areSculpting each tree to fit your ghostly formIn white, in paint too representativeCentimetersthat the height of the canvasXVII. GreenlandPreface to the 1970 EditionOr else, like us, sunk into some long gazeSo, startled, quivering,Choces, Mère and Père, undreaming even of fieldsThat patch of white at the very end of the roadIV. The Paths to Cathaysnoozing. A schoolgirl on vacation gapes,the foul pole relaxes. She's raged all afternoonThis gap in time, this season not their own,Alberti, Brunelleschi, Sangallo,
